page.title: 11West Bretton
page.content: From junction 38 of the M1 we followed the A637 to West Bretton past the war memorial and parked opposite the cricket field. Then we walked past Town Farm to meet Mr. Wilkinson,who had lived in the village all his life. He told us that the butcher's shop and post office building used to be a farm and they used to burn charcoal there. Now there are only five working farms. Every September they have a flower show in the village Institute.We visited the school which has 50 pupils, 3 teachers and 1 helper. Most children walk to school or come by car. At 11 years they move on to Horbury Comprehensive School. The boys play cricket and football, the girls rounders and netball. We watched them practising for sports day.
